title: Cremet pasta med asparges

co2_per_kg_db.closest_match_explanation: Exact match not found for 'fresh pasta', but 'pasta, raw' is a valid broader category for fresh pasta (Rule 2). It is the least processed pasta option available and thus the best match (Rule 4).

weight_estimate.weight_calculation: 1 clove garlic = 4 g, 2 * 4 g = 8 g = 0.008 kg

Multiple cream options available. 'cream, whipping, 38 % fat' is chosen as it matches the typical cream type and has a higher emission than cultured cream but less than ice cream (Rule 4 and 5).

instructions: Put a saucepan over with water to the pasta. Cook the pasta as directed on the package and pour the water off. Crack the ends of the green asparagus and cut them for approx. 1 cm long pieces. Sweat onion and garlic in oil on a hot pan. Add squash and asparagus and sweat for a few more minutes, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Put the water on the pan and crumble the broth cube in to dissolve it. Pour the cream on with grated parmesan and turn it all around well. Turn the fresh pasta into the mixture and finally mozzarella and fresh basil. Taste with pepper. Serve the dish as it is or with meat or fish next to it.
